Reason: The configuration option 'tombstone_warn_threshold' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the warning threshold for tombstones in the database. A lower threshold may result in more tombstones being generated, leading to increased read latency and potentially higher memory consumption. On the other hand, a higher threshold may delay tombstone removal, affecting write performance and potentially causing increased disk usage. Therefore, changes in the 'tombstone_warn_threshold' value can significantly affect system performance in terms of both execution time and memory consumption.
